xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>W</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = (U_2 - U_1) + W</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>180</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>400</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>80</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = (180 - 400) + 80</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">180</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">400</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">80</span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>220</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>140</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = -220 + 80 = -140 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">−</span><span class="mo">220</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">80</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">−</span><span class="mo">140</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p>This heat rejected from the cylinder is: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>140</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">140 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">140</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>.</p><ol start="2"><li>During a compression stroke in an automatic engine, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>40</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">40 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">40</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span> of heat is rejected to the cooling water. If the work input is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>80</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">80 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">80</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>, calculate the change in internal energy of the working fluid.</li></ol><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = -40 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">−</span><span class="mo">40</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>80</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg&nbsp;since&nbsp;</mtext><mi>Q</mi><mtext>&nbsp;is&nbsp;</mtext><mo>−</mo><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">W = -80 \text{ KJ/kg} \text{ since } Q \text{ is } -ve</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">−</span><span class="mo">80</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;since&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;is&nbsp;</span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s31">v</span><span class="mord mathnormal">e</span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>W</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U_2 - U_1 = Q - W</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>80</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = -40 + 80 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">−</span><span class="mo">40</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">80</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>40</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = +40 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">+</span><span class="mo">40</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p>Since the change in internal energy is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">+ve</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6667em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mo">+</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s31">v</span><span class="mord mathnormal">e</span></span></span></span></span> it implies a gain in internal energy.</p><p>Steady flow process → A process in which matter and energy flow in and out of an open system at steady rates.</p><p>Characteristics of a steady flow process:</p><ol><li>The rate of heat transfer is constant.</li><li>The rate of work transfer is constant.</li><li>The ratio of mass flow at inlet and outlet is the same.</li></ol><p>CS CamScanner</p><p>2.) Steady flow of energy equation (SFEE)
→ In most practical problems the rate at which a fluid flows through a machine is assumed to be constant.
→ Consider a steady flow of 1kg of fluid through a piece of apparatus in the figure below.</p><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-0a8b67bc.jpeg" alt="img-6.jpeg"></p><p>Datum line (reference line) → Z₁
Z₂
→ Z₁</p><p>Let Q be the heat supplied to the system per kg of the fluid.
W = work done by the fluid as it passes through the apparatus.</p><p>At inlet, let:
Internal energy = U₁
Flow work = P₁V₁
Kinetic energy (K_E₁) = ½C₁²; C₁ = Velocity / speed at inlet, m = 1kg
Potential Energy (P_E₁) = Z₁g
Heat supplied = Q</p><p>At outlet, let:
Internal Energy = U₂
Flow work = P₂V₂
Kinetic energy (K_E₂) = ½C₂²</p><p>(Mgh) Potential Energy (P_E₂) = Z₂g
Work done = W</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>→ For steady flow, energy entering the system must be exactly equal to the energy leaving the system.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Z</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mi>g</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Z</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>g</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>W</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U_1 + \frac{C_1^2}{2} + Z_1g + P_1V_1 + Q = U_2 + \frac{C_2^2}{2} + Z_2g + P_2V_2 + W</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.1771em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span mtight">1</span></span></span><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s6">W</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>→ The sum of internal energy, and the PV term is known enthalpy, and is denoted by <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="s6">W</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-error" title="ParseError: KaTeX parse error: Expected 'EOF', got '_' at position 131: … \quad \text{(U_̲2 + P_2V_2)} = …" style="color: rgb(204, 0, 0);">S \cdot F \cdot E \cdot E \left[ \frac{U_1 + P_1V_1}{h_1 + \frac{C_1^2}{2} + Q} = h_1 + \frac{C_2^2}{2} + W \right] \quad \text{(U_2 + P_2V_2)} = h_2</span></div><p>Steady flow energy eqn</p><p>→ The mass flow rate in the steady flow system can be determined from the continuity of mass equation, which is:</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>m</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow><mi>V</mi></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\dot{m} = \frac{C A}{V}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6679em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6679em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.1389em;"><span class="mo">˙</span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.0463em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.3603em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>where</p><ul><li><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">m</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span></span></span></span> = mass flow rate in Kg/s</li><li><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span> = Velocity (m/s)</li><li><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">A</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span> = Cross-sectional Area of the Pipe. (m)</li><li><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span></span></span></span></span> = Specific Volume of the fluid. (m³/kg)</li></ul><p>Example:</p><ol><li>A mass of gas flows through a gas turbine unit at the rate of 18 Kg/s and develops 15000 Kw of power. The enthalpies of gases at inlet and outlet are 1250 and 400 Kg/kg respectively. The velocities of gases at the inlet and outlet are 60 m/s and 150 m/s respectively.</li></ol><p>a) Calculate the rate at which heat is rejected from the turbine
b) Calculate the area of the inlet pipe.</p><p>Take the specific volume of the gases at inlet to be 0.5 m³/s</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>m</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn><mtext>kg/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>15000</mn><mtext>KW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1250</mn><mtext>KJ/kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn><mtext>KJ/kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mi>φ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">?</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
\dot{m} = 18 \text{kg/s} \\
P_g = 15000 \text{KW} \\
h_1 = 1250 \text{KJ/kg} \\
h_2 = 400 \text{KJ/kg} \\
C_1 = 60 \text{m/s} \\
C_2 = 150 \text{m/s} \\
V_1 = 0.5 \text{m}^3/\text{kg}
\end{array}
\quad
\varphi = ?</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 8.4em; vertical-align: -3.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 4.45em;"><span style="top: -6.61em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord accent"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6679em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.1389em;"><span class="mo">˙</span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="ms" style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">15000</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">KW</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.936em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">833.33</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Hence:</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.25em" columnalign="right left" columnspacing="0em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>11.25</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>833.33</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mi>φ</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>400</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>11.25</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>833.33</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1250</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1.8</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mi>φ</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1244.58</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1251.8</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mi>φ</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7.25</mn><mtext>KJ/kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{aligned}
1250 + 1.8 + \varphi &amp;amp;= 400 + 11.25 + 833.33 \\
\varphi &amp;amp;= (400 + 11.25 + 833.33) - (1250 + 1.8) \\
\varphi &amp;amp;= (1244.58 - 1251.8) \\
\varphi &amp;amp;= 7.25 \text{KJ/kg}
\end{aligned}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6em; vertical-align: -2.75em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="col-align-r"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.25em;"><span style="top: -5.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span CamScanne</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>150</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mls</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.60</mn><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup><mspace \frac{0.5 \times 18}{150 \text{ mls}} = 0.60 \text{m}^2 \quad A_2 = \frac{V_m}{C_2}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s38"><span class="ps" style="height: style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t mtight">m</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.836em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><ol start="2"><li>A mass of air flows steadily through an air compressor at the rate of 6.35 Kgl/s. Heaters at a velocity of 6.2 m/s, pressure of <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><msup><mtext>N/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1.0 \times 10^5 \text{N/m}^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">1.0</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.204em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">5</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">N/m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.954em;"><span style="top: -3.2029em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> and a specific volume of 0.80 m³/kg and leaves the compressor at a velocity of 4.2 m/s, a pressure of <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>7.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><msup><mtext>N/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">7.0 \times 10^5 \text{N/m}^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">7.0</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.204em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">5</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">N/m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.954em;"><span style="top: -3.2029em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> and a specific volume of 0.15 m³/kg. The internal energy of air leaving is 90 KJ/kg, greater than that of air entering. Cooling water in a jacket surrounding the air absorbs the heat from air at the rate of 60 KJ/s.</li></ol><p>Calculate:
a) Power required to drive the compressor.
b) The area of cross section of the inlet pipe.
c) The area of cross section of the outlet pipe.</p><p>Soln.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.80</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mtext>J/kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>7.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>×</mo><mn>0.15</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>105</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mtext>J/kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mi>W</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo fence="true">(</mo><mfrac><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo fence="true">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo fence="true">(</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo fence="true">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mi>W</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>90</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>10.4</mn><mn>1000</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>25000</mn><mn>1000</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mi>W</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>174.9896</mn><mtext>KJ/kg</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{aligned}
\dot{m} &amp;amp;= 6.35 \text{ Kgl/s} &amp;amp; C_1 &amp;amp;= 6.2 \text{ mls} \\
P_1 &amp;amp;= 1.0 \times 10^5 \text{N/m}^2 &amp;amp; C_2 &amp;amp;= 4.2 \text{ mls} \\
V_1 &amp;amp;= 0.80 \text{m}^3/\text{kg} &amp;amp; P_2 &amp;amp;= 7.0 \times 10^5 \text{N/m}^2 \\
V_2 &amp;amp;= 0.15 \text{m}^3/\text{kg} &amp;amp; Q &amp;amp;= 60 \text{KJ/s} \\
U_2 - U_1 &amp;amp;= 90 \text{KJ/kg} \\
U_1 + \frac{C_1^2}{2} + P_1 V_1 + Q &amp;amp;= U_2 + \frac{C_2^2}{2} + P_2 V_2 + W \\
K_E &amp;amp;= \frac{C_1^2}{2} = \frac{6.2^2}{2} = 19.22 \text{J/kg} \\
K_{E2} &amp;amp;= \frac{C_2^2}{2} = \frac{4.2^2}{2} = 8.82 \text{J/kg} \\
P_1 V_1 &amp;amp;= (1.0 \times 10^5 \times 0.80) = 80,000 \text{J/kg} \\
P_2 V_2 &amp;amp;= (7.0 \times 10^5) \times 0.15 = 105,000 \text{J/kg} \\
W &amp;amp;= (U_1 - U_2) + \left( \frac{C_1^2}{2} - \frac{C_2^2}{2} \right) + \left( P_1 V_1 - P_2 V_2 \right) + Q \\
W &amp;amp;= -90 + \frac{10.4}{1000} + \frac{25000}{1000} + -60 \\
W &amp;amp;= -174.9896 \text{KJ/kg}.
\end{aligned}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 24.7802em; vertical-align: -12.1401em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="col-align-r"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 12.6401em;"><span style="top: -15.2912em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.4911em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord accent"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6679em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.1389em;"><span class="mo">˙</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -13.6772em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.4911em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -12.0632em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.4911em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -10.5391em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.4911em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -9.0391em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.4911em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" text"><span class="mo">It&nbsp;is&nbsp;a&nbsp;triangle</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Temperatures of</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>Relationship between the two specific heat</p><p>→ In thermodynamics there are two specific heat i.e.
i) Specific heat at constant pressure, (Cp)
ii) Specific heat at constant Volume (Cv)</p><p>→ The general definition of specific heat is</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>φ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">d\varphi = mc dT</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mord mathnormal">c</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>→ For a perfect gas, the specific heat at constant pressure (Cp), and specific heat at constant Volume (Cv) can be assumed to be constant at all pressures and temps.</p><p>→ At constant pressure, for a reversible non-flow process the equation above becomes:</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span text"><span class="mo">—&nbsp;(v)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>→ Equating equation (v) with equation (i) for the heat flow it gives:</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><div class="math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">R</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.00773em;">R</span></span></span></span></span> is called gas constant.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mi>u</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>Universal&nbsp;gas&nbsp;constant</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>8314</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>1J/kgK</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">R_u = \text{Universal gas constant}
= 8314 \cdot \text{1J/kgK}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.00773em;">R</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">8314</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">1J/kgK</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>v</mi></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>&nbsp;(gamma)</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{C_p}{C_v} = 1 \text{ (gamma)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.1963em; vertical-align: -0.836em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.3603em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t mtight">p</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.836em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;(gamma)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>The ratio of the two specific heat is given by the equation above.</p><p>Hence the characteristic equation of a gas becomes:</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>v</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P_v = mRT</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" class="s31">v</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">RT</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Gibbs free Energy (Gibbs function Gibbs energy or free enthalpy)</p><p>Is a quantity that is used to measure the maximum amount of work done in a thermodynamic system when the temperature and pressure are kept constant.</p><p>Entralpy of the system minus the product of the temp times the entropy.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>H</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>T</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">G = H - TS</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">G</span><span class="ms" class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">TS</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>p</mi><mo columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mtext>+T</mtext></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
U = \text{Internal energy (joules)} \\
P = \text{Pressure (pascal)} \\
V = \text{Volume (m}^3\text{)} \\
T = \text{Temperature (K)} \\
S = \text{entropy (j/K)} \\
H = \text{enthalpy (J)} \\
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
\Delta G \\
\Delta S \Delta G \\
\Delta G \Delta S = T \\
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
\text{endothermic reaction} \\
\text{+T} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 7.314em; vertical-align: -3.407em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.45em;"><span style="top: -3.61em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">endothermic&nbsp;reaction</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -2.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">+T</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.95em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>THERMODYNAMIC PROCESSES</p><p>→ The heating and expansion of gas may be performed in many ways, the following are reversible thermodynamic processes:-
Reversible process.
→ It is a process in which some changes in reverse direction reverse the process completely and initial conditions are restored at the end of the cycle.</p><p>→ The processes are as follows:-
i) Isocentric thermodynamic process (isometric, isovolumetric) (Constant volume process)
ii) Isobaric (Constant pressure process) {Charles law}
iii) Isothermal (Constant temp process) {Boyle law}
iv) Isentropic (Adiabatic)
v) Polytropic
vi) Hyperbolic</p><p>&lt;isocentric (isometric, isovolumetric)="" process=""&gt; Is a thermodynamic process where the volume of the system remains constant during heating and expansion.
→ When a gas is heated at a constant volume, its temp and pressure will increase but since there is no change in volume, no work is done by the gas.
→ All heat supplied to the gas is stored within the gas infirm of internal energy (i).
→ This process is governed by gay lubacks law which states that "the pressure of a gas is directly proportional to its temp when the volume is kept constant".</p><ul><li>Consider a gas of mass (mkg) being heated at a constant volume from initial state (i) to final state (ii).
Let P, V, T₁ be pressure, volume and Temp at initial state (i)
P₀V₂T₂ be pressure, volume and Temp after heating (corresponding)</li></ul><p>CS CamScanner&lt;/isocentric&gt;</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="derivation-of-constant-volume-formulas">Derivation of Constant Volume Formulas<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#derivation-of-constant-volume-formulas" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><ol><li><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>V</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>T</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P-V-T</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7667em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7667em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span></span></span></span></span> R/Ship.
from the general gas equation</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" \text{Constant}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.0463em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen → In thermodynamics, work done is given by:</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>NB This shows that in isochoric the heat supplied to the gas at constant volume is used in increasing its internal energy. 1.e. Heat supplied = Internal energy.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>U</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = U</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span></span></span></span></span></div><ol start="5"><li>Change in Enthalpy (dH)
dH is the same for all processes.</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>H</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>P</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">dH = H_{2}-H_{1} = mC_{P}(T_{2}-T_{1})</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0813em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Exi:1
A certain gas occupy a space of 0.3m³ at a pressure of 2 bars and a temp of 77℃. It is heated at a constant volume until the pressure is 7 bars. Determine:
a) The temp at the end of the process
b) Mass of the gas.
c) Change in internal energy.
d) Change in enthalpy
e) Work done by the gas.</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mi>N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>&nbsp;pascal.</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1bar = 1 \times 10^5 N/m^2 = 1 \text{ encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{P_1}{T_1} = \frac{P_2}{T_2}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.3335em; vertical-align: class="mo">KJ</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>e) Work done.
Work done in isochoric is zero
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>D</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">W_0D = 0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">D</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">0</span></span></span></span></span> because there is no change in Volume.
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>W</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">W_{1-2} = 0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8917em; vertical-align: -0.2083em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span><span class="mbin mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2083em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">0</span></span></span></span></span>
f) Heat transferred.
It is the same as change in internal energy
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>371.931</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>KJ</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= 371.931\, \text{KJ}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">371.931</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">KJ</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><hr><p><strong>ISOBARIC PROCESS (Constant pressure)</strong></p><p>→ When a gas is heated at a constant pressure in temp and volume will increase. Since there is a change in its volume, therefore the heat supplied is utilised to increase internal energy of the gas hence there is work done.</p><p>→ It is governed by Charles law.</p><p>→ Consider a mass (mkg) of a gas heated at constant pressure of initial state (I) to final state II
Let p_i V_i T_i be pressure, volume, temp in state I and p_2 V_2 T_2 be corresponding values in state II.
Derivation of constant pressure process.</p><ol><li><strong>P-V-T Relationship.</strong></li></ol><p>From the General gas equation:
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi></msub><mi>T</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{P_V}{T} = C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.2336em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen class="mo">Charles’&nbsp;law.</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><ul><li>Hence governed by Charles' law which states that "Volume of a fixed mass of a gas is directly proportional to its temp when the pressure is kept constant.</li></ul><p>CS CamScanner</p><ol start="2"><li>Work done by the gas.</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span \dots \quad (1)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8917em; vertical-align: -0.2083em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="minner">…</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>But from characteristic gas equation:</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">PV = mRT</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">RT</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-error" title="ParseError: KaTeX parse error: Expected &amp; or \\ or \cr or \end at end of input: …n (2) into (1)}" style="color: rgb(204, 0, 0);">\begin{array}{l}
\begin{array}{ll}
\text{at state 1} &amp;amp; P_1 V_1 = mRT_1 \\
\text{"2} &amp;amp; P_2 V_2 = mRT_2 \\
\text{but} &amp;amp; P_1 = P_2 = P \\
&amp;amp; PV_1 = mRT_1; \quad PV_2 = mRT_2 \quad \dots \quad (2)
\end{array} \\
\text{Substituting equation (2) into (1)}</span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>W</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>W</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><menclose notation="box"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><msub><mi>W</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>R</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mstyle></mstyle></menclose><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>M&nbsp;-&nbsp;mass&nbsp;in&nbsp;kg.</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>R&nbsp;-&nbsp;Gas&nbsp;Constant.</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
W_{1-2} = PV_2 - PV_1 \\
W_{1-2} = MRT_2 - MRT_1 \\
\boxed{W_{1-2} = MR(T_2 - T_1)} \quad \text{M - mass in kg.} \\
\quad \text{R - Gas Constant.}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 5.28em; vertical-align: -2.39em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.89em;"><span style="top: -5.14em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.09em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span><span class="mbin mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2083em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>NB In constant pressure process the heat supplied (Q) is equal to the change in enthalpy. (Q = H)</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><ol><li>The values of specific heats at constant pressure and constant volume of an ideal gas are 0.984 KJ/KgK and 0.728 KJ/KgK respectively. Find the values of characteristic gas constant, the ratio of the two specific heats for the gas, if one Kg of gas is heated at a constant pressure from 25°C to 200°C. Estimate the heat added, also calculate the pressure and find volume of the gas, if the initial volume is 2m³. Also calculate the work done.</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" energy)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9694em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord class="st" style="height: 0.9694em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><mo class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.14</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.285</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>373</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>21000</mn><mn>106.305</mn></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>194.549</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>Kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
P_1 V_1 = M R T_1 \\
m = \frac{P_1 V_1}{R T_1} \\
= \frac{1.5 \times 10^5 \times 0.14}{0.285 \times 373} \\
= \frac{21000}{106.305} \\
= 194.549 \times 10^{-3} \\
= 0.2 \, \text{Kg} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 7.5599em; vertical-align: -3.5299em;"></span><span class="mo"><span display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>KJ</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= 15 \, \text{KJ}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">15</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">KJ</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CP - specific heat at constant pressure</p><p>CV - specific heat at constant volume</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="isothermal-constant-temp-process">ISOTHERMAL (Constant temp process)<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#isothermal-constant-temp-process" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><p>→ A process in which the temp of the working substance remains constant during compression or expansion.</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="characteristics">Characteristics<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#characteristics" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><p>i) No change in temp
ii) No change in internal energy (u)
iii) No change in Enthalpy (H)</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="derivation-of-constant-temp-process">Derivation of Constant temp process<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#derivation-of-constant-temp-process" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><ol><li>P-V-T R/Ship from general gas equation</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mfrac><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi></msub><mi>T</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>but&nbsp;</mtext><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><menclose notation="box"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mstyle></mstyle></menclose><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>governed&nbsp;by&nbsp;</mtext><menclose notation="box"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mtext>Baylas&nbsp;law</mtext></mstyle></mstyle></mstyle></menclose><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">✓</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
P_1 V_1 T_1 = P_2 V_2 T_2 \\
\frac{P_V}{T} = C \\
\frac{P_1 V_1}{T_1} = \frac{P_2 V_2}{T_2} \quad \text{but } T_1 = T_2 \\
\boxed{P_1 V_1 = P_2 V_2} \quad \text{governed by } \boxed{\text{Baylas law}}. \quad \checkmark
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 5.351em; vertical-align: -2.4255em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.9255em;"><span class="mo">Baylas&nbsp;law</span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.0344em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.5689em;"></span><span class="stretchy fbox" style="height: 1.5689em; class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.4255em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><ol start="2"><li>Change in internal energy (dU)</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mi>V</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>but&nbsp;</mtext><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo separator="true">;</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mfrac><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>T</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mi>T</mi></mfrac><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">✓</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
du = U_2 - U_1 = M C V (T_2 - T_1) \\
\quad \text{but } T_1 = T_2 \\
du = U_2 - U_1 = 0 \\
U_2 - U_1 = 0; \quad \frac{U_2}{T} = \frac{U_1}{T} \quad \checkmark
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 4.8484em; vertical-align: -2.1742em;"></span><span class="mo"><span dH = H_2 - H_1 = m C_p (T_2 - T_1) \\
\quad \text{but } T_1 = T_2 \\

class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="derivation-of-work-done-in-isothermal">Derivation of Work Done in Isothermal<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#derivation-of-work-done-in-isothermal" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor"
